review: Amazon could rule the TV world by merging the TIVO broadcast TV recording and menus feature into this box. Broadcast HD is cheaper and looks better and is the cheap lure to Amazon content sales.  Its really a no brainer.
author: TerryG

review: A solid product (I got it to compare against the AppleTV & because my Samsung smart TV doesn't have the Amazon ap - & we watch a lot prime content).  On the pro's, the voice command capability is great - something AppleTV does not yet feature.  However the major drawback is that the Fire TV has a difficult time w/ less than bountiful Internet BW.  I tried it both w/ High speed cable Internet (50Mb/s) where it works great & a 3Mb/s DSL service where it struggles to play content (unlike the AppleTV which handles the lower BW environment w/out issue).My recommendation is a buy if you need the Amazon prime app (for a TV that doesn't have it),  or want voice commands, & you have high speed service (something significantly more than a 3Meg DSL - the curse of country living).  However if you need AirPlay &/or have a slow DSL service, stick to the AppleTV.
author: M. Doggett "mdog"
